body_html:
@civilmanxx The --input_saver parameter takes a SaverDef proto file, which you can retrieve via tf.train.Saver.as_saver_def()

But perhaps a better question: why are you trying to freeze the graph?
body_text:
@civilmanxx The --input_saver parameter takes a SaverDef proto file, which you can retrieve via tf.train.Saver.as_saver_def()
But perhaps a better question: why are you trying to freeze the graph?
body:
@civilmanxx The `--input_saver` parameter takes a `SaverDef` proto file, which you can retrieve via `tf.train.Saver.as_saver_def()`

But perhaps a better question: why are you trying to freeze the graph?
